repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p:
A composite manuscript containing:
The Tivviyappirapantam 2791-3892, that is, the Tiruvāymoḻi (Indien 544a).
The Irāmāṉucanūṟṟantāti, incomplete in 36 stanzas (Indien 544b).
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (March 2023).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

collation.desc: 1 bifolio = guard leaf. Truncated. Recto darker = original outside page. Verso blank. 410 x 30 mm.
100 folios = Tivviyappirapantam 2791-3892, that is, the Tiruvāymoḻi.

additions.desc: BnF shelfmark sticker, covering an older sticker: INDIEN 544 (f[1]r).
BnF register information, in black ink: RC. 7881 (f[1]r).
Number 50. in black ink on a small square hard paper tied to the string. Typical shelfmark of manuscripts from Haas.

binding.p: No wood covers. 1 stringhole for U1 and Indien 544b. 2 stringholes for Indien 544a .

origin.origDate: The Tiruvāymoḻi (Indien 544a) is nternally dated to the year raudri of the Jovian cycle, that is, CE 11860-1861, 1800-1801, 1740-1741, etc. See colophon (U1, f100v8).

acquisition.p: Acquired, December 18th, 1886, from M. Haas. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 2 = Acquisitions: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1893, no. 7881.

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See p. 76, no. 544.
Vinson, Julien & Feer, Léon & s.n. 1866-. Catalogue des manuscrits tamoul et télinga. Manuscript, BnF Indien 577. — See f. 123r, no. 544.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
